{{disambig-two: '''Mewlips''' were a legendary race of evil creatures only mentioned in [[Hobbits
the evil creatures: Hobbit]] verse. The creatures were likely fictitious, although they could have been inspired by [[Orcs]].<ref>{{HM

{{disambig-two: Living beyond the [[Merlock Mountains]] and the marsh of [[Tode]], they are said to have fed on passers-by, collecting their bones in a sack.<ref>{{AB
In ''[[The Hobbit]]'', [[Bilbo Baggins]] learned that the [[Long Marshes]] had grown wider, consuming paths and lost people.<ref>{{H
the evil creatures: Welcome}}</ref>  In plot notes that [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] made while writing the story the raftsmen told tales of disappearing rafts, men, and beasts;<ref>{{HH
[[Index:Poems by J.R.R. Tolkien: PNB}}, p. 362</ref>  [[John D. Rateliff]] suggests that the more ominous line in the notes may indicate that Tolkien had some unpleasantness in mind had [[Thorin and Company]] gotten into the marshes - perhaps meeting the Mewlips.<ref>{{HH

{{disambig-two: :''Mewlips'', described and given statistics in various supplements, are portrayed as undead beings living in swamps and marshes. The race is conceived as having been created by [[Morgoth]] in the [[Elder Days]].<ref>{{ICE
